meanings.definition: Convert (energy) from one form to another.
meanings.sent1: She was transducing sunlight into electricity using solar panels.
meanings.sent2: The radio waves were transducing into sound waves for the listeners.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's power involved transducing energy to create force fields.
meanings.sent4: The artist was transducing her emotions into a beautiful painting.
meanings.sent5: The windmill was transducing the wind's energy into power for the village.

meanings.definition: Transmit (a signal) from one form to another.
meanings.sent1: The satellite was transducing the data signal back to Earth.
meanings.sent2: The translator was transducing the message from English to Spanish.
meanings.sent3: The robot was transducing the distress signal to the rescue team.
meanings.sent4: The conductor was transducing the music signal to the orchestra.
meanings.sent5: The walkie-talkie was transducing the voice signal across the field.

meanings.sent1: The virus was transducing the genetic material into the host cell.
meanings.sent2: The bacteria were transducing the DNA to adapt to the environment.
meanings.sent3: The scientist was transducing the gene sequence for the experiment.
meanings.sent4: The gene therapy was transducing healthy genes into the patient's cells.
meanings.sent5: The genetic engineer was transducing traits to create a new breed of plants.
